definition: hot and sour soup/sour and spicy soup
sour/tart/sick at heart/grieved/sore/aching/pedantic/impractical/to make sarcastic remarks about sb/an acid
hot (spicy)/pungent
rushing current
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
surname Tang

sentences.english: Which soup do you want? We have Eggdrop Soup with Sliced Tomatoes, Famous Hot &Sour Soup.
sentences.chinese: 您來點什麼湯？我們有番茄蛋花湯，酸辣湯。

sentences.english: Paggy tell Paul, hot and sour soup is very delicious.
sentences.chinese: 佩琪告訴保羅，酸辣湯非常的好喝。

sentences.english: Which do you prefer, sour peppery soup or four-jewel soup?
sentences.chinese: 你喜歡什麼湯，酸辣湯還是四寶湯？

sentences.english: Hmm…Black pepper beef, fried shrimp and hot&sour soup.
sentences.chinese: 嗯黑胡椒牛柳，油煎大蝦，再來個酸辣湯吧。

sentences.english: We've got hot and sour soup and seaweed soup.
sentences.chinese: 我們有酸辣湯和紫菜湯。

sentences.english: We'll take the Sichuan hot and sour soup.
sentences.chinese: 我們來份川味酸辣湯吧。

sentences.english: Hot and Sour soup is a standard in Chinese cuisine in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，酸辣湯是標準的中國菜。

sentences.english: We have frozen dumplings again become a hot and sour soup?
sentences.chinese: 我們有速凍水餃，再做個酸辣湯吧？

sentences.english: Hot and sour soup, please, and that's enough for me.
sentences.chinese: 來酸辣湯吧，我想這些菜已經夠了。

sentences.english: I really like this sweet and sour soup.
The Sichuan Hot and Sour Soup is very delicious.
sentences.chinese: 要不要來一碗湯？四川酸辣湯味道很好的。

sentences.english: I enjoy going to Chinese restaurants and ordering coke and hot and sour soup.
sentences.chinese: 我非常喜歡到中國餐館和訂購焦炭和酸辣湯。

sentences.english: That spicy soup gave me a terrible stomachache.
sentences.chinese: 那個酸辣湯害我肚子好痛。

sentences.english: The lot and sour soup is always a favorite with our customers. It's typical Chinese soup.
sentences.chinese: 酸辣湯一直受到顧客的青睞，這是典型的中國湯菜。

definition: soft mixed vegetable and meat roll-up
jelly snack made by kneading jelly fig seeds 愛玉子|爱玉子[ai4 yu4 zi3] in water and combining with flavorings (popular in Taiwan and Singapore)
plain noodles in broth
rice in gravy, typically with meat and vegetables
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
noodle soup/noodles in soup/noodle broth
ta-a noodles or danzai noodles, popular snack originating from Tainan
knife-shaved noodles (pared or shaved into strips), a Shanxi specialty
Peking Duck
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒賣|烧卖[shao1 mai4]
pork ball
noodles served with soy sauce/sesame butter etc
custard bun
borscht, a traditional beetroot soup
steamed dumpling
oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
